item.title: August was Medium’s first profitable month — ever
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
August was online publishing platform Medium’s first profitable month — ever. That’s according to Medium CEO Tony Stubblebine, who on Wednesday published a recap of Medium’s recent digital Medium Day 2024 conference. Stubblebine says that Medium had over a million members as of April, and that more members “than ever before” are subscribing to the […]

item.title: This founder had to train his AI not to Rickroll people
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Flo Crivello was monitoring outputs from the AI assistants his company Lindy makes when he noticed something strange. A new client had asked her Lindy AI assistant for a video tutorial that would help her better understand how to use the platform, and the Lindy responded in kind – that’s when Crivello knew something was […]

item.title: Apple is bringing audio sharing to Beats Studio Pro via firmware update
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
A firmware update is delivering multi-user audio sharing, allowing music to be streamed to multiple headphones at once.

item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:

item.title: First look at the Startup Battlefield judges at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024

item.description:
The Startup Battlefield is the crown jewel of Disrupt, and we can’t wait to see which of the thousands of applicants will be selected to pitch to panels of top-tier VCs at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024, taking place on October 28–30 in San Francisco. It’s always epic, and every contender is on the road to making a huge […]

item.title: D-ID launches an AI video translation tool that includes voice cloning and lip sync
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
AI video creation platform D-ID is the latest company to ship a tool for translating videos into other languages using AI technologies. However, in this case, D-ID also clones the speaker’s voice and changes their lip movements to match the translated words as part of the AI editing process. The technology stems from D-ID’s earlier […]

item.description:
A bug in the iPhone makes it crash just by typing four characters.

item.title: Bodies of Autonomy founder Mike Lynch and his daughter recovered from sunken Bayesian yacht
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Grim news coming in from Sicily, Italy. Mike Lynch, the U.K. investor and founder of IT company Autonomy, has been identified as one of two bodies recovered from the Bayesian, the yacht that sunk off the coast of Sicily early Monday, according to several reports coming out of the country that cite the chief of […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: This startup wants to mine water on the moon
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Meet Starpath, a startup that wants to make it possible for you to live on Mars one day.  Starpath is building robots that it hopes will be able to autonomously mine liquid oxygen from the moon. That liquid oxygen can then be used to develop fuel for spacecrafts, which could make it possible for humans […]

item.title: Zomato buys Paytm’s entertainment ticket business for $244 million
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Zomato, the Indian food delivery giant, has acquired the entertainment ticketing business of financial services firm Paytm for $244.1 million, signaling a strategic move to expand its “going out” offerings. The acquisition, among the largest M&A deals among new-age Indian tech companies, includes Paytm’s ticketing services for movies, sports and events. As part of the […]

item.title: Two incident management startups join forces as FireHydrant nabs Blameless
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
FireHydrant, an NYC incident management startup that launched in 2019, announced on Wednesday that it has acquired Blameless, a former competitor. The companies did not share the purchase price. Both companies help SREs (site reliability engineers) deal with the daunting job of keeping software and websites up and running. When things go wrong, they help […]

item.title: Ring’s new battery doorbell has head-to-toe video
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Ring announced on Wednesday the next generation of its Battery Doorbell. For $100, customers get extended battery life, color night vision, a head-to-toe view of visitors and a new push-pin mounting system.  Head-to-toe HD video was previously only available with the Doorbell Plus and Pro models. Now, according to Ring, the Battery Doorbell provides a […]

item.title: Openmart wants to make it easier for enterprises to sell to local businesses

item.description:
In 2020, Kathryn Wu launched a side hustle while she was working as a product engineer at Pinterest. item.title: Grafana Labs raises $270M

item.description:
Grafana Labs, the open source company that probably powers at least a few operational dashboards in your company, today announced the completion of a primary and secondary transaction worth about $270 million, with the proceeds going to the company and some of its stockholders. The company describes this as an extension to its $240 million […]

item.title: Ford says a pickup truck will be the first EV built on its low-cost platform
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
The first vehicle that will be built on the low-cost EV platform Ford’s been developing in secret will be a mid-size pickup due out in 2027, the automaker announced Wednesday morning. The news comes as part of a much larger rewriting of Ford’s electrification plans. The company is abandoning a plan to make an all-electric […]
